Have fun!
Use at your own risk!\n\nThe chair of \"Digital Communicationsystems\" does not give any warrantys.

"

Chair of Digital Communication Systems

Our area of research is information transfer. Our main focus is the characterization of fundamental limits for reliable and spectrally efficient communication in the following areas (but not limited to)

  • Interference Networks and Alignment
  • Robust Beamforming and applied optimization methods
  • Two-Way Full-Duplex Communication
  • Physical Layer Security
  • Relaying
  • Multiple antenna systems (MIMO) and Space-Time Coding
  • Device-to-Device (D2D)  and low-latency communication

As part of our integral approach, we complement the theory with the design of methods that approach those limits. The circle comes to a close by experiments making use of devices like

  • Universal Software Radio Peripheral (USRP)
  • Raspberry Pi and Arduino,

which are used for validation and for the development of realistic communication models. The websites provide a finer look at the nature of our interests and contributions.


SHK - Programming

This Application is the result of two students, who work for the DCS.

Tim Guenther
  • Management
  • Design
  • Programming
Max Hoffmann
